definition: ordinal number/day of a month/mark/sign/business establishment/size/ship suffix/horn (wind instrument)/bugle call/assumed name/to take a pulse/classifier used to indicate number of people
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]

sentences.english: A trumpeter swan glides across the surface of the Yellowstone River.
sentences.chinese: 一只号手天鹅正游过黄石河的水面。

sentences.english: I hear thee trumpeter , listening alert I catch thy notes.
sentences.chinese: 我听到你，号手，我警觉地倾听着你的声音。

sentences.english: They swept into the hall, preceded by trumpeters.
sentences.chinese: 他们以号手为前导昂首阔步走进大厅。

sentences.english: The model was made by Trumpeter from Mainland China.
sentences.chinese: 模型是由中国大陆的小号手出产。

sentences.english: The smuggler shrugged to the bugler hugging the bug in the tugboat.
sentences.chinese: 私运者对在拖船中拥抱臭虫的号手耸耸肩。

sentences.english: I was a trumpet player in the jazz band at school.
sentences.chinese: 在学校时我是爵士乐队的小号手。

sentences.english: Simultaneous to this engagement, Scipio had all his trumpeters blow at once to startle the elephants.
sentences.chinese: 同时，西庇阿命令所有号手一起鸣号来惊吓战象。

sentences.english: One day the king returned home from a good raid. He ordered his trumpeters to play.
sentences.chinese: 有一天，国王进行大搜捕回来，他命令号手吹号。

sentences.english: The site provides the musicians' names and a photo of the lead trombonist.
sentences.chinese: 网页提供了音乐家们的名字和一张首席长号手的照片。

sentences.english: The little bugler bravely squared up to his enemy.
sentences.chinese: 小号手英勇地面对敌人。

sentences.english: He's a good horn player,but it takes him half the evening to get hot.
sentences.chinese: 他是个挺不错的号手，不过要吹到下半宿才上劲。

sentences.english: The pastor said the usual prayers and the bugler played taps.
sentences.chinese: 牧师按常规做了祷告，号手吹起了军号。

definition: to steer (a vessel)/to hold the rudder/at the helm
warrant officer/petty officer/noncommissioned officer (NCO)/Japanese military officer
honor guard/guard of honor/the banner bearing contingent leading a military procession
